meanings.definition: Omit or suppress (a sound or syllable) in pronunciation.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, people elide certain sounds when speaking quickly.
meanings.sent2: It is common in some languages to elide certain syllables for easier pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would elide all the difficult sounds in the language to make it easier for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice seemed to elide the harsh consonants, creating a smooth and melodic tone.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to elide the silent letters in the words to improve their pronunciation.
